newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS oil futures fall in light front-month.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS oil futures fall in light front-month.

text.p: Prices for U.S. crude oil futures eased in after-hours ACCESS trade Wednesday, with refiners focusing on March contracts instead of volatile front-month deliveries, brokers said.
Daytime February crude bounced back after a slow start, rising on news Russian President Boris Yeltsin must remain in hospital for the week recovering from pneumonia.
Russia is one of the world's largest oil producer.
NYMEX February crude settled 84 cents higher at $25.95 a barrel after falling as low as $24.65 a barrel.
But levels consolidated overnight, as the contract fell 14 cents to $25.81 a barrel.
"The market could use more of a correction," a trader said, noting activity was 400 lots in February versus 1,100 in March.
"There's less activity in the front month....People are selling the March thinking it's more profitable," the trader said.
NYMEX February heating oil fell a slight 0.27 cents a gallon to 71.15 cents a gallon as a light 113 lots traded in February and 138 overall.
Gasoline futures edged down 0.35 cents a gallon to 68.50 cents with 26 lots traded in the nearby contract and 36 in all months.
